markdown: Additional Q&A – Not Fully Reviewed by LT/OTP Steering Comm. More Q&A General – For Use With All Audiences/Stakeholders Q: Why these test markets, Austin and Portland? A: We think these two markets will provide us the most effective learning. Q: Why are you not aiming primarily to reach adult moist snuff users (loose tobacco, tobacco which requires the consumer to spit)? A: We are. Our target group includes all adult tobacco consumers. ## General - Product Q: How do you use Camel Snus? A: Simply slip the packet in the side of your mouth between the lip and gum. A single pouch can last up to one hour. In focus-group testing, adult consumers told us the preferred amount of time to keep the packet in their mouth was anywhere from 10 to 30 minutes. Q: Is Camel Snus like Skoal or other smokeless tobacco products? A: No it is not. Unlike those products, Camel Snus does not require the consumer to spit. Additionally, Camel Snus is not available in a loose format. It's also made differently. It has less salt and less moisture content that other moist snuff. It is also pasteurized, while most moist snuff is fermented. Q: Can you swallow your saliva/snus packet? A: Unlike other smokeless tobacco products, Camel Snus does not require the consumer to spit, so you can swallow the saliva. Q: What does it taste like? How long do you keep it in your mouth? A: It has a tobacco taste. People usually keep a pouch in the mouth from 10 to 30 minutes. Q: How many do people typically use in a day? A: That is difficult to predict as tobacco use varies by consumer. Source: https://www.industrydocuments.ucsf.edu/docs/gpfl0225 55824 1425

General – For Use With All Audiences/Stakeholders

Q: Why these test markets, Austin and Portland? A: We think these two markets will provide us the most effective learning. Q: Why are you not aiming primarily to reach adult moist snuff users (loose tobacco, tobacco which requires the consumer to spit)? A: We are. Our target group includes all adult tobacco consumers.

## General - Product Q: How do you use Camel Snus? A: Simply slip the packet in the side of your mouth between the lip and gum. A single pouch can last up to one hour. In focus-group testing, adult consumers told us the preferred amount of time to keep the packet in their mouth was anywhere from 10 to 30 minutes. Q: Is Camel Snus like Skoal or other smokeless tobacco products? A: No it is not. Unlike those products, Camel Snus does not require the consumer to spit. Additionally, Camel Snus is not available in a loose format. It's also made differently. It has less salt and less moisture content that other moist snuff. It is also pasteurized, while most moist snuff is fermented. Q: Can you swallow your saliva/snus packet? A: Unlike other smokeless tobacco products, Camel Snus does not require the consumer to spit, so you can swallow the saliva. Q: What does it taste like? How long do you keep it in your mouth? A: It has a tobacco taste. People usually keep a pouch in the mouth from 10 to 30 minutes. Q: How many do people typically use in a day? A: That is difficult to predict as tobacco use varies by consumer.
